website_summaries.verdict: This small, 78-page book is full of helpful survival tips and tools and is a fun, easy read.
pros: Nester injects humor into his writing
Touches on a number of topics, including how to make your home self-reliant, cooking when the power's out, and even long-term sanitation and hygiene tips
We love the helpful summary at the end of each chapter

customer_reviews.title: A Well-done Overview of Key "Grid-Down" Survival Issues
customer_reviews.text: There's a LOT of useful info packed into this small volume's 78 pages. Tony Nester cuts right to the chase in each chapter (Creating a Self-Reliant Home; Water Storage/Purification; Food Recommendations/Storage; First-Aid Kit; Home Security/Personal Defense; Heating, Cooling, Lighting and Cooking When the Power Goes Out; Long-Term Sanitation and Hygiene) with very specific recommendations, plus the back of the book provides suggestions on sources of necessary kit and relevant training courses, books and videos.
customer_reviews.author: Major Mike

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! Perfect for people looking to start with the basics, but also gives direction for people who want to learn more. A clear and easy to understand read. Each section has a summary and a suggested supplies list. I live in the city and this is great for "urban" survival. I already feel more prepared just having read the book! I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Clayton

customer_reviews.title: book - When The Grid Goes Down
customer_reviews.text: I already have 3 books dealing with this subject, but this one has practical information and advice that it turns out the others did not. I'm taking the advice to heart. As this review is typed, North Korea has just openly threatened to attack the USA using a nuclear device to produce an EMP - which would destroy the 60-Hz grid in a substantial chunk of America. So the subject matter is a-propos.
customer_reviews.author: NoVA guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent place to start for all levels of preparation
customer_reviews.text: Some good, basic advice for preparation. I like the Summary checklists provided with each section, how the author offers several options/ideas for purchases/solutions in each area, useful (not complicated) instructions, and excellent diagrams/photos.
customer_reviews.author: Helen in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Very informative
customer_reviews.text: Even though I have a survivalist background as a rural raised, self sufficient, Hunter, and fisherman. Army and Navy trained background, I learned and was exposed to some ideas that I had never thought of. Great resource.
customer_reviews.author: KyGoods

customer_reviews.title: You can Get the Info for Free
customer_reviews.text: Almost all of the information in this book can be found on the Internet in various "prepping" and survival sites. With the pandemic.fear level as it is now.. DO NOT spend the quoted price of $60+ dollars!!!! Google!! It is a VERY basic book that, in my opinion, is overpriced, but hey for people who don't want to search/think, it may be worth it.... JMO
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming.
customer_reviews.text: Basically a pamphlet that presents little more than the boy scout handbook and on some topics not as much. Very little first person reviews experience or justification but a lot of reference to people the author spoke to. If you were a totally neophyte to outdoors or hazardous weather impact and thinking personal security it might be an adequate introduction to considerations. Pretty much all the topics covered in a couple prep magazines.
customer_reviews.author: Sabot

customer_reviews.title: Great book with lists
customer_reviews.text: This book has been so helpful for us to get our emergency kits prepared. It has list of things that you should have and make suggestions for any type of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: Learned more in Boy Scouts then this book. Might be a little help to an urban dweller. In the Q&A section of the book he recommended another book titled "One Second After" which I have read and found it had better information on how to survive if the grid goes down!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should know what's in this book.
customer_reviews.text: This had great information but it's pretty slim. I'd recommend getting it in digital format, it's that slim. Still, it covers some basic areas and is good if you know nothing about planning for disaster. If you do know some, you might be disappointed by how basic this is. I gave it 4 stars because the author seems quite credible and does not waste your time with superfluousness. I will look into other publications by the author.
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Great starter book!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few month after Irma in 2017 to help us better understand and prepare fir the next storm. Im am not a true preper and found the info in the book to be very balanced and easy to read and understand. Had my wife read it who loathed the subject, but after reading the book was totally behind hurricane prep. Highly reccomend for begginers.
customer_reviews.author: CosmicBoss

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Book for people interest in the subject matter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well thought out book and covers topics to my satisfaction. I like the fact that the author gives recommendations and examples in each category and follows up with a summary at the end of each chapter. This is a basic book for people looking for advice on how to get started in preparing for the unthinkable. He writes from many years of experience. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L. Hemphill

customer_reviews.title: Good Book
customer_reviews.text: A good quick book. More of an overview of what you need to do, but with enough detail to give and idea of what your getting into. Touches on guns, but puts more emphasis on water, food storage, keeping warm and first aid. The book is not afraid to tell you you probably need to take some serious classes such as first aid. I never felt that the books authors were belittling me. The don't talk down to you. Good read if your starting out and trying to get a idea of whats ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Allbluster Grumbley

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: The book was very vague and cheap looking. The content was ok but it is hard to read and put together poorly. I was disappointed especially since Amazon claims it is a #1 bestseller.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Evitts

customer_reviews.title: This book is a beginners book at best. The author only makes suggestions
customer_reviews.text: This book is a beginners book at best. The author only makes suggestions. No instructional type info in this text. I should have payed closer attention to other reviews. If you have any survivalist skills at all this book is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Moore

customer_reviews.title: Without foretelling the apocalypse, this is a handy primer ...
customer_reviews.text: Without foretelling the apocalypse, this is a handy primer on how to survive a simple outage of our modern way of life. I went right out to Home Depot and bought a lantern and a cast iron skillet.
customer_reviews.author: C. druehl

customer_reviews.title: Good info
customer_reviews.text: While I already knew about 80% of the information in this book, I did learn some new things. Good information for anyone interested in prepping for disasters or just wanting to gain new insights. Keep in mind the preparation guides in this book is only for 1-3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Good information
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I read this book and found it very informative. We have ordered a medical kit and will order some of the suggested books.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: If you just want pulp w no war stories, this is the book. If you want common sensy workable ideas for survival and prepping, this is the book. If you want to refresh or remind of good ideas and techniques, this is the book. Buy this book, pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Book has a major printing flaw
customer_reviews.text: Both the original book ordered and the replacement book have a major printing flaw. all left side pages have a 1/2 inch wid vertical streak on every page that renders the text unreadable.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Jett

customer_reviews.title: A Bible for survival!!
customer_reviews.text: A must have book! It’s got all the down a dirty keys to survival. A great eye opener for me. Plan on getting a gun for home defense and start storing rain water and that’s just the start! Thank you so much for opening my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Many

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Okay I guess. Has a lot of stuff most people know. I would consider myself pretty new in learning survival skills and I knew a lot in this book already. Has a few useful tips though.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: The possibility of our grid going down by natural causes ...
customer_reviews.text: The possibility of our grid going down by natural causes is very high, especially now with the technology of today. I would encourage everyone to read this, and/or other books on this subject. Just look up the "Carrington Event"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way too generalized...don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't even waste your money. This book and its sections are SO short and generalized. It looks as if the author just through this thing together on a Sunday. If you get this book, you'll see what I mean. There are MUCH better books and resources out there....seriously and honestly....don't waste your money. Look elsewhere. UPDATE: There are other good books worth your time and money....the following is one of them which will be released this August 2014:  Another one is:
customer_reviews.author: Denson Guitar

customer_reviews.title: Common sense, nothing new
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Common sense. Nothing new. Nothing you can't find online.
customer_reviews.author: GLT

customer_reviews.title: Good read , but there's more info out there
customer_reviews.text: This is a good first basic look into preparing for the great grid gatastophy that could or could not happen in the very near future. It taps on different areas with your basic approach to deal with the scenario . Was happy with the purchase but still yearned for a lil bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Poe Phat

customer_reviews.title: Best comprehensive book I've read on this subject so far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert; I'm barely prepared, but having grown up in the southeast, I have had to deal with some situations that caused a pretty high level of stress. Oh, how I wish I'd had this book prior to living through some of those events! Mr. Nester is not wordy, he is practical, practiced, and able to succinctly get the important information across. Love the way he annotates his work so you can follow up in more detail on any area of interest. This book will be in Christmas stockings this year! Highly, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SpacedMom

customer_reviews.title: Basic good survival guide!
customer_reviews.text: Basic emergency preparedness for basic survival mode. Made my list and am far better ready for the unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a common sense book. I was looking for something a little more in-depth. Don't get me wrong, it is a good book, just not a $15 book and not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Concise, clear, organized.
customer_reviews.text: Concise, clear, organized. And covers extensive subject range. I don't need opinions and editorials like some authors are your new BFF. Also contains helpful links to other resources. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and no nonsense approach to the topic.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this rating because the book covered the topics and answered my questions on what I needed to survive if the grid goes down. The author was very knowledgeable and I liked his no nonsense approach.
customer_reviews.author: GloryBx3

customer_reviews.title: Preparedness library : preparing for losing the grid. Permanently.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson borrowed this book and won't give it back. It's that good. Buy it. Better, buy two so you can lend one and still have one.
customer_reviews.author: Ampara Matley

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive guide.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little book. It was comprehensive in the scope of what one might face and need. I think it could morph into a larger and more abundant work. It illuminated some issues that I had not considered. Glad I purchased this book.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Erdmann

customer_reviews.title: Good info to have
customer_reviews.text: Good info to have. Too much to remember. Hopefully there will be enough light to read the book if the grid actually goes down. Lots of prep stuff to take care of beforehand as well. And stuff you don't think about.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Everyone Should Have This
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I got the book, I read the first 20 pages and I’ve already learned more than I expected. I didn’t really realize how unprepared we were, but that’s why I bought it after all.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: When the grid goes down for a short time
customer_reviews.text: Once the bleach, canned food, batteries, and propane tanks are gone, . . . Fine for short-term emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Simple read & a little over priced.
customer_reviews.text: A good starter book - provides a simple description of the basics: being prepared at home, at work, car, & bug out bag. The author lives in the South West U.S. so many of his tips & resources are regarding that area. The pictures are minimalistic. A little too pricey for only a thin 77 page book.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: The man knows what he is talking about!
customer_reviews.text: The author writes from years of experience and it shows. The book gives very practical advice on where and what to purchase in the way of supplies and equipment. It's an easy read and straight to the point.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every household
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should be prepared with at least the basics, get this book and you'll have it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom and Heather

customer_reviews.title: not bad
customer_reviews.text: most of it i knew but a couple things i had not thought of.not bad book
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ain't no doomsdayer but when I do....
customer_reviews.text: Really quick and thorough. I'm by no means a doomsdayer per say but I have been interested lately in ensuring my family is in the best possible position if something happens. This book gives real life people, easy to execute directions on how to deal with several disasters.
customer_reviews.author: djpayback

customer_reviews.title: Survive
customer_reviews.text: This book was interesting and gave good practical information. Very good for a beginner survivalist. Would recommend to other for reading and as a reference.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had more pages
customer_reviews.text: Okay Gave me some ideas and thoughts to ponder. Guess I was expecting more pages.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Felsberg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent practical guide
customer_reviews.text: Great book - not crazy doomsday prepper type, but very practical advice for what to do if you simply lose power - basic things you should have on hand, etc. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa N

customer_reviews.title: When The Grid Goes Down
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that this book wasn't larger. I guess the author decided to pass along the information with brevity.
customer_reviews.author: ConnieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Solid book with great info
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast read with great info and resources.
customer_reviews.author: Meli

customer_reviews.title: great info
customer_reviews.text: a lot of great info in the book at a great price .
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good advice to be found in a small book- everyone ...
customer_reviews.text: Good advice to be found in a small book- everyone should have some kind of knowledge on how to prepare if a disaster should occur and in today's world, it's certainly possible. This was a very practical and easy to follow guide, even if you are approaching it from a beginner standpoint, like me.
customer_reviews.author: Watcher0fW0rlds

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't what I expected at all. Very minimal real world issues that most don't already know.
customer_reviews.author: Mercury Horses

customer_reviews.title: Glad I have this
customer_reviews.text: Handy little book to have around or in your Go Pack. Good information that I wouldn't have come up with on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good read, very informative. I’ve been reading up on survival prepping and getting myself ready. I’d personally like to see you write about building up to get in shape for the known and why. I think that might give us some insight.
customer_reviews.text: Good job, I liked the entire thing. More books are needed. Keep writing and inform that’s the best you can do to save people.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Jarzembowski

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Neat ideas to keep in mind just in case something happens and you are stuck out somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: jane

customer_reviews.title: more than wets the appetite
customer_reviews.text: This is very thought-provoking and something that can be consumed in just one sitting. There's a lot of extremely practical information and also opens the doors of thought regarding the issues that one may have to addressed whether they're living in urban or rural setting and under a number of different circumstances. I highly recommend this as an initial resource for preparing for tough times up ahead. Don't keep your head buried in the sand but start somewhere and start now.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Russo

customer_reviews.title: Good info - easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Good info, easy to follow. I think it would be a great starter book for those who are exploring the art of prepping, and a good review for the "experienced" Prepper.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to put in gift emergency bags for grandchildren. Hope they never have to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Quiring

customer_reviews.title: Great start to expanding learning & preparation for several scenarios.
customer_reviews.text: A great list of books, DVDs, and web sites to further you knowledge and prepare for emergencies. I'm impressed with the information.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy D. Olson

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: No real information presented, IMHO. But it sure did seem like a plug to buy products...
customer_reviews.author: K. K. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: No bad
customer_reviews.text: Being in the military I will say the author has some great and must advice for the novice in surviving a disaster. Even having had to live in auteur conditions in the field or deployed I did find some ideas that will be helpful even for the experience person. I would recommend this book to people.
customer_reviews.author: douglas smith

customer_reviews.title: Very useful book.
customer_reviews.text: Small book that covers the essential basics. End of each chapter has a handy to do and to obtain list. Easy read without a bunch of fluff. Information is well organized by priority.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Keast

customer_reviews.title: Good read
customer_reviews.text: I'm just starting out prepping so I've been trying to learn more about it before spending a butt load of cash on gadgets and seek out more traditional methods used by experienced survivalist. I pulled several tidbits out of the book to study and research. I felt the book was worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Good knowledge
customer_reviews.text: You can never prepare enough to keep your family safe in all situations
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This book is a a joke.. tiny little book, which is more like a “table of contents” than an informative book. Listing only subjects but no real information about any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Donna DiNapoli

customer_reviews.title: Handy, easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Covers the basics very well. Assumes a person is level-headed and willing to plan ahead for logical responses to survival challenges.
customer_reviews.author: freewoman1

customer_reviews.title: Way overpriced at $11. I flipped through the book ...
customer_reviews.text: Way overpriced at $11. A very thin, small format book. Example tips: "Keep your cooler in the shade", "Only open the cooler when absolutely necessary". All true, but self-evident to a thinking person. I wonder if the author has a website or a weekend class that he typed up the notes for, and published as a book? It has that feel.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting read full of useful information in case of a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Stella's Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good book - rehash of many other books, but still good
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Prepping Overview
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good overview of things to be considered for the time when you May need to "Be Prepared".
customer_reviews.author: Candace Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great tips
customer_reviews.text: There’s lot of great tips on surviving if the grid goes down. It talks about them in order from most important to least important things to have. It’s also a great portable size.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Demont

customer_reviews.title: Outdated!
customer_reviews.text: Very old info. Much more available now than when this was published.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice preparedness book
customer_reviews.text: A nice book for those starting into disaster preparedness. It has good tips, and a nice list. The price was good, too.
customer_reviews.author: S.Poye

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good book. Kinda wish I got the paperback version
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good book. Kinda wish I got the paperback version, to go over, review, and work on without having to use the Kindle to read it. Great intro to prepping for all reason, real and imagined!
customer_reviews.author: Edward McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good read
customer_reviews.text: Overall good, would have liked some more depth and details in many areas but what do you expect for a few bucks. Lot's of references to other gear and books was helpful. I enjoyed the down to earth, practical and realistic approach.
customer_reviews.author: PistolPete

customer_reviews.title: Reads like a high school freshman's research paper
customer_reviews.text: Reads like a high school freshman's research paper. There's better info for free online — if you want a book of it, just print it out — it'll have better info than this book anyway.
customer_reviews.author: E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Decent book for general information but not a lot of detail. Only 77 pages.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Good Prep Book!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read and has a checklist at the end of each section!
customer_reviews.author: cartersb25

customer_reviews.title: Very short book.
customer_reviews.text: Basic needs book. This is not exactly when the grid goes down, but things everyone should know on a daily.
customer_reviews.author: I.Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: He gives you enough information informal you can get started where ever you live. a practical starting guide. I now know how to get my home in order. An if I need not in-depth information he points you forward too.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Mumford

customer_reviews.title: For beginners
customer_reviews.text: Very straightforward instruction manual on how to get started prepping. Easy read without all the annoying acronyms (SHTF, EOTWAWKI, etc) and hysteria.
customer_reviews.author: DeEllen Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff to know.
customer_reviews.text: A good road map book that talks about some basics as well as pointing us to some further ideas and resources for basic survival efforts.
customer_reviews.author: saxxman747

customer_reviews.title: Very Informative
customer_reviews.text: The writer highlights the topics and provides plenty of relevant insight. He goes through tips in enough detail on what you will need to improve your chances of surviving a crisis.
customer_reviews.author: RLawitzke

customer_reviews.title: not recommended
customer_reviews.text: He just has a basic information is not worth the price I do not recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Bill A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read. Gets to the point without a bunch of fluff.
customer_reviews.author: Dan at AFT

customer_reviews.title: fantastic book of knowledge
customer_reviews.text: fantastic book. Great insight and knowledge in this book. so many great tips that the book is invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Callen

customer_reviews.title: This book is like 65 pages of text including pictures of things such ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is like 65 pages of text including pictures of things such a a package of wet-wipes. Basically this is a book of common sense as it is too short to teach anyone anything. At best this is for starters. Big dogs are good, but never is it asked how much food does it cost to maintain a big dog? Some of the advice is questionable and nothing is delved into.
customer_reviews.author: grandfatherjoe

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: This book definitely has some great ideas for SHTF type situations. I recommend buying it in tandem with Joel Skausen's book on strategic relocating. No one wants to live in fear and paranoia, but it is good to be as prepared as you can be.
customer_reviews.author: Gelato Girl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Very interesting read. I would suggest everyone consider this on.
customer_reviews.author: Don P.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: When I order a book like this, I am looking for specific, detailed information. There are many good and helpful pieces of information in this book. I was very happy to see and to use the resource list at the end.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: It's a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my brother-in-law because he's waiting for the government to collapse *...I know...* But he said that he loves this book. It has good suggestions and ideas for preparing for disasters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What you need to know
customer_reviews.text: Well written n easy to comprehend I enjoyed the information and having this book apart of my collection
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Very interesting
customer_reviews.text: I found the information very helpful. I don't think you can be 100% prepared this book does a great job instructing you in the basics and the thought process for success in those situations.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Handy book
customer_reviews.text: This book, although small, is packed with a lot of good information. It's a good tool to help you get your priority list formatted and has recommendations on where you can find hard to find items.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Good for servival bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a short read but it covers a good bit of supplies and strategies needed to survive. I like the check list. This on i keep in my survival grab and go bag.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: good information - not too 'end of the world' more ...
customer_reviews.text: good information - not too 'end of the world' more New England nor'easter kind of information - easy to read. Love the summaries at the end of each chapter.
customer_reviews.author: Alison G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good, easy read based on common sense.
customer_reviews.text: Nice introductory book to prepare essential skills and tooks. Easy reading. Good, practical advices are shared. Mixing light humor and seriousness of topics.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Papadatos

customer_reviews.title: Solid, sensible information for being prepared for emergencies...
customer_reviews.text: This is a well thought out and highly sensible guide to being prepared for emergencies, whether natural disasters or whatever. There are certain things we must have to live as human beings, and Tony Nester addresses these and their applications, whether one lives in an urban setting or in the country. He is a refreshing and authoritative author and guide, who has the personal experience and knowledge to share, and does so with reasonableness and credibility. Nester avoids the hype and paranoid skewing of the subject so prevalent today, and provides sensible and grounded advice and knowledge. Get this brief and concise book, for yourself and for those you love and care about...
customer_reviews.author: RC Evans

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for basics, easy to read, and engaging. A more comprehensive book would be a Boy Scout Handbook.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cole

customer_reviews.title: what can I say good info but can be found online for free
customer_reviews.text: well, what can I say good info but can be found online for free.
customer_reviews.author: Hey guys

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not enough detail on how to deal with or survive the grid going down.
customer_reviews.author: David D. Chenevert

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This is not a book but a leaflet, with hardly any relevant details. Much too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Bas de Way

customer_reviews.title: always be prepared
customer_reviews.text: this is a good book on the subject of disaster preparedness but I would also read Arthur Bradleys book on disaster preparedness (neither book is about wilderness survival) they are more geared to hunkering down in a home situation and the needs you will have and how to fill those needs without all the modern conveniences we enjoy today.
